info.title: Windows Build - Media Creation API
info.description:
To use this API, you will need a JWT bearer token. Using Azure CLI (get it here), you can get a token with one of the following commands:
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.microsoft.com/MediaCreation-stable-MediaApi"
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.mspmecloud.onmicrosoft.com/MediaCreation-blackwidow-MediaApi"
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.mspmecloud.onmicrosoft.com/MediaCreation-captainamerica-MediaApi"
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.mspmecloud.onmicrosoft.com/MediaCreation-hulk-MediaApi"
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.mspmecloud.onmicrosoft.com/MediaCreation-ironman-MediaApi"
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.mspmecloud.onmicrosoft.com/MediaCreation-thor-MediaApi"
az account get-access-token --resource "https://mediacreation.mspmecloud.onmicrosoft.com/MediaCreation-hawkeye-MediaApi"

post.summary: Schedule specified media for a certain graph.

parameters.name: requestedByUser
parameters.description: A String that identifies the user who made the request.

requestBody.description: A list of the media to schedule.

200.description: The Request Id that can be used to check status

post.summary: Schedule specified media for a certain graph.

parameters.name: requestedByUser
parameters.description: The user submitting the optimistic request, if not passed it grabs the user from the httpcontext.

requestBody.description: A list of the media to schedule.

200.description: The Request Id that can be used to check status

post.summary: Defines a graph and returns that graph id.

200.description: The GraphId for the newly defined graph

get.summary: Get all GraphMedia requests for the given parameters

200.description: A list of the possible media to build for this graph

get.summary: Gets all GraphMedia requests that are bound to this media. All requests for which this media is on the critical path.

200.description: A list of the possible media to build for this graph

get.summary: Get all optimistic requests for the given parameters

200.description: A list of the possible media to build for this graph

post.summary: Schedule specified media for a certain graph.

parameters.name: requestedByUser
parameters.description: A String that describes the user who made the request.

requestBody.description: A list of the media to schedule.

200.description: The Request Id that can be used to check status

post.summary: Schedule specified media for a certain graph.

parameters.name: requestedByUser
parameters.description: The user submitting the optimistic request, if not passed it grabs the user from the httpcontext.

requestBody.description: A list of the media to schedule.

200.description: The Request Id that can be used to check status

get.summary: Get the possible media to build from a given graph.

parameters.name: graphId
parameters.description: The graph in which to build the media.

200.description: A list of the possible media to build for this graph

get.summary: Get all requested media from this user with status

parameters.name: graphId
parameters.description: The graph in which to build the media.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A String that describes a specific user.

200.description: A list of the possible media to build for this graph

post.summary: Defines a graph and returns that graph id.

200.description: The GraphId for the newly defined graph

post.summary: Defines a batch of media for a given graph.

parameters.name: graphId
parameters.description: A Guid which describes the graph ID.

requestBody.description: The list of manifests for the media.

post.summary: Defines a batch of canonical editions for a given graph.

parameters.name: graphId
parameters.description: A Guid which describes the graph ID.

requestBody.description: The list of canonical editions to be defined.

post.summary: Defines a batch of canonical editions for a given build.

parameters.name: buildGuid
parameters.description: A Guid which describes the build ID.

parameters.name: schedule
parameters.description: A Boolean which describes whether or not to optimistically schedule the defined editions.

parameters.name: requestedByUser
parameters.description: The user submitting the optimistic request, if not passed it grabs the user from the httpcontext.

requestBody.description: The list of canonical editions to be defined.

200.description: The Request Id that can be used to check status

get.summary: Gets RequestGraph Metadata needed for migration

parameters.name: graphId
parameters.description: The id in which to define the media.

200.description: A list of the possible media to build for this graph.

category.description: Gets or sets the type of graph.

buildGuid.description: Gets or sets the Build Guid.

bmtToolsHints.description: Gets or sets Tools hint file.

additionalBuildMetadata.description: Gets or sets additional build metadata.

requestId.description: Gets the unique identifer for the request

graphId.description: Gets the unique identifer for target graph for this request

buildGuid.description: Gets the unique identifer for target build for this request

artifactName.description: Gets the name of the artifact for this request

flavor.description: Gets the flavor of the artifact for this request

requestedByUser.description: Gets the name/identifier of the identity which made this request

requestMetadata.description: Gets the metadata sent by user alongside request

requestType.description: Gets the type of the request (Optimistic or GraphMedia)

requestedTime.description: Gets the time that the request was made

name.description: Gets or sets a name for this link.

rel.description: Gets or sets the relation for this link.

href.description: Gets or sets the target URI for this link.

MediaDefinitionDto.description: Definition for a piece of media.

BuildableArtifactStatusChangeDto.description: Represents a status update to a buildable artifact.

newStatus.description: Gets or sets the new status of the artifact.

trace.description:
Gets or sets a JSON object containing any additional information
about the status change.

BuildableArtifactFailedDto.description: Represents a buildable artifact failed message and includes error details.

errorMessage.description: Gets or sets the error message for the failure.

fingerprintPart1.description: Gets or sets part1 of the error fingerprint.

fingerprintPart2.description: Gets or sets part2 of the error fingerprint.

fingerprintPart3.description: Gets or sets part3 of the error fingerprint.

fingerprintPart4.description: Gets or sets part4 of the error fingerprint.

category.description: Gets or sets the type of graph.

buildGuid.description: Gets or sets the Build Guid.

bmtToolsHints.description: Gets or sets Tools hint file.

editionName.description: Gets or sets the edition name.

runlevel.description: Gets or sets the base SKU (as runlevel).

flavors.description: Gets or sets the possible flavor permutations.

features.description: Gets or sets the feature packages to add.

name.description: Gets or sets a name for this link.

rel.description: Gets or sets the relation for this link.

href.description: Gets or sets the target URI for this link.

BuildableArtifactStatusChangeDto2.description: Represents a status update to a buildable artifact.

newStatus.description: Gets or sets the new status of the artifact.

trace.description:
Gets or sets a JSON object containing any additional information
about the status change.

BuildableArtifactFailedDto2.description: Represents a buildable artifact failed message and includes error details.

errorMessage.description: Gets or sets the error message for the failure.

fingerprintPart1.description: Gets or sets part1 of the error fingerprint.

fingerprintPart2.description: Gets or sets part2 of the error fingerprint.

fingerprintPart3.description: Gets or sets part3 of the error fingerprint.

fingerprintPart4.description: Gets or sets part4 of the error fingerprint.
